intro: Campanula medium f. alba, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
